page.title: 06AVON WALKWAY WEST OF BATH
page.content: {The Avon Walkway}is a rough riverside path and an excellent walk for a naturalist.The first part borders farm land but later it goes through thin woodland.There are numerous insects such as dragonflies and damselflies.At many points the banks are eroding causing over-hangs.There are lots of different flowers the main ones being dandilions,nettles,clover,buttercups, cowparsley,white dead nettles,cat mint ,thistles,comfrey,pink campian,forget me nots,rushes and wild garlic.There are lots of hazel trees but there are sycamore and willow trees.Crossing the walkway is a railway bridge which is now a cycle track.Canal barges and boats use the river mostly at weekends .There is also private fishing.There is a marina with a cafe.I would recommend this to anyone who likes walking.
